title: Magic SysRq key - Wikipedia
excerpt: The magic SysRq key is a key combination understood by the Linux kernel, which allows the user to perform various low-level commands regardless of the system's state. It is often used to recover from freezes, or to reboot a computer without corrupting the filesystem.[1]  Its effect is similar to the computer's hardware reset button (or power switch) but with many more options and much more control.
